stream_context.summary: Kaze integrates Biobak’s just-finished visual remake of Course 1, fixes rendering and performance issues, and begins importing new actors and effects in preparation for a one-level public demo.

development_findings.summary: Course 1 visuals were completely re-modeled by Biobak; Kaze adjusted layer assignments and draw-order to avoid overdraw artifacts.
development_findings.quote: Today we are working on the rework of Course 1 that Biobak just finished – the drawing order here is pretty messed up, so we’re moving as much as possible to layer 0.

development_findings.summary: A single-stage demo build is planned; Kaze’s immediate task list is: finish Area 1 fixes, import new actors, then redo all collisions.
development_findings.quote: The demo will just be one stage, nothing more. First fix Area 1, then import the actors, then do all the collisions.

development_findings.summary: Performance remains near 60 FPS on real hardware after the rework; CPU shows roughly 73 % idle time, and enabling the ‘X3’ vertex buffer gives a small boost.
development_findings.quote: In a 33.3 ms frame we have 24.3 ms idle – the CPU isn’t working two-thirds of the time. With X3 it’s even faster.

development_findings.summary: ROM size has reached 63 MB; Kaze wants to stay under the 64 MB boundary to keep the project authentically ‘N64’.
development_findings.quote: My ROM is around 63 MB. If you go over 64 MB, are you really still making an N64 game? It feels like cheating to me.

development_findings.summary: Implemented camera-driven spinning lens-flare sun; issue with texture clamping and mirroring was solved by disabling mirroring.
development_findings.quote: It’s still doing it with clamping on… oh, I pressed the wrong export button. Just turn mirroring off, then this will work.

development_findings.summary: Added ‘nose jiggle’ soft-body physics to Mario using a custom physics bone and pendulum math; highly optimized to avoid crashes.
development_findings.quote: This is hyper-optimized: if you change one thing it crashes, but it works very well.

development_findings.summary: Fixed alpha-stripe rendering bug by removing ‘coverage for alpha’ in the render mode, improving both visuals and RDP time.
development_findings.quote: I must have accidentally checked coverage for Alpha – that’s definitely going to be bad. Turning it off dropped the RDP time a bit.

development_findings.summary: Planned YouTube mini-series that analyzes each course to surface design insights and solicit community feedback.
development_findings.quote: I’m thinking of making a series on my second channel that analyzes why every individual course is worth playing.

development_findings.summary: Imported or queued new actors: Yoshi Egg (colour-tinted per level), Bouncy Float, Goomba King (3 materials, half‐size), Spike Goomba, Para-Goomba, Bunny Goomba, Rabbits, Windmill Propeller, retro pipes and flag.
development_findings.quote: First of all, we have a Yoshi egg now… Goomba King saved three materials and his helm is half the size.

development_findings.summary: Collision data still belongs to older geometry; Kaze will regenerate it after visuals lock.
development_findings.quote: We reworked the level and some ground changed – the collision is not being reworked yet.

context_findings.summary: Modding income from YouTube/Patreon is less than half of Kaze’s regular job salary.
context_findings.quote: Modding makes me some amount of money through YouTube and Patreon, but it’s not even half of what my normal job makes.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values authenticity to original console limits and wants the hack to be ‘the prettiest N64 game’ while still running at full speed.
context_findings.quote: I’m pretty sure this already is the prettiest N64 game there is.

context_findings.summary: Streams are intentionally ‘minimum effort’; Kaze streams mainly for real-time feedback, not as a professional content creator.
context_findings.quote: You need to realize my streams are minimum effort – I stream because I like having people give me feedback.

context_findings.summary: Displays playful frustration toward bugs and chat suggestions but also excitement when fixes work.
context_findings.quote: Hell yeah… this is just what I wanted!

biobak.summary: Delivered full visual rework of Course 1, including new background concept (infinite distant sky) and asset optimizations (fewer materials, reduced triangles).
Provided updated models for multiple enemies (Goomba King, Spike Goomba, Bunny Goomba, Paragoomba, Rabbits) with reduced material count and cleaner UVs.
biobak.quote: Saved three materials and fourteen triangles on Goomba King; I had so much room left that I gave his shoes some shine.

badub.summary: Composed new multi-channel music variants for different biomes; tracks will fade in/out based on player location.
badub.quote: What I forgot to mention is this song has versions for every biome – it will smoothly fade mini-channels in and out.

key_stories.title: Keeping It ‘Real N64’
key_stories.summary: With the ROM at 63 MB, Kaze debates whether exceeding 64 MB would undermine the claim that the game runs on original hardware.
key_stories.challenge: Visual upgrades and new assets are inflating the ROM size.
key_stories.process: Benchmarks and asset audits are performed while discussing authenticity limits with chat.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze decides to stay under 64 MB, calling larger images ‘cheating’; asset size will be monitored going forward.
key_stories.key_quote: If you go over 64 MB, are you really still making an N64 game?

key_stories.title: The Spinning Sun Lens Flare
key_stories.summary: Biobak requested a dynamic sun effect that rotates with camera movement. Kaze implemented it, fought a clamping bug, and tuned pitch/yaw influence.
key_stories.challenge: Initial implementation showed texture seams and abrupt flips.
key_stories.process: Disabled mirroring, adjusted UV rotation, reduced influence values, and re-exported level multiple times.
key_stories.outcome: Stable, camera-responsive lens flare now brightens the sky without artifacts.
key_stories.key_quote: Just turn mirroring off, then this will work.

key_stories.title: Mario’s Bouncy Nose
key_stories.summary: Kaze created a physics bone so Mario’s nose wobbles when he moves, showcasing advanced custom animation techniques.
key_stories.challenge: Add soft-body style motion within strict performance limits.
key_stories.process: Added GeoMarioNoseJiggle bone, stored last-frame position, derived acceleration, applied pendulum math, and optimized heavily.
key_stories.outcome: A believable, low-cost soft-body effect; code is fragile but performant.
key_stories.key_quote: It’s a genuine physics bone; change one thing and it crashes, but it works very well.
